reviews.title: Lovely food
reviews.text: Stayed in Goathland at a cottage and had dinner twice at the hotel. Both me and my Mum thoroughly enjoyed our meals. We have eaten there when we have visited Goathland over the last 10 years and have never had a bad meal.
However, I cannot comment on the B&B as we have never stayed there!
reviews.title: The Goathland Hotel
Gastronomic disaster makes you miss a Heartbeat
reviews.text: Just had an enjoyable hot meal at Goathland Hotel for lunch. Man at the bar could maybe have been a bit more friendly, but overall I liked the visit. Earlier in the week I had a meal in the evening which was served by a very polite and friendly girl. The open fire gives both warmth and atmosphere.

reviews.title: THE GOATHLAND HOTEL (MAKE UP YOUR OWN MIND)
reviews.text: After spending the weekend in Whitby with my partner and our two friends where we were spoilt by having superb accomodation, and lovely food, we decided to pop into Goathland on our way home.

reviews.title: Sunday lunch letdown.....
reviews.text: I had enjoyed the tv series ' Heartbeat', and thought it would be nice to see where it had been filmed. After having a look around the pretty little village of Goathland, we decided to have something to eat, and went to the Goathland hotel, (aka The Aidensfield Arms )

reviews.title: Child unfriendly
reviews.text: It never ceases to amaze me how in Britain we treat families appallingly in pubs. Called in to the Goathland Hotel today 4 adults and 2 children, (14 and 12). We were told quite politely we couldn't be in the bar as they did not have a 'Children's License' and instead had to go in the 'Family Room' a room at the back so devoid of atmosphere it almost sucked the life out of you. To encourage us that this was the place to be we were told there were lots of memorabilia of Heartbeat?? consisting of a TV with a loop of photos from around the area and an aged photo of the cast of the TV programme, - how long can this place trade on this connection??. The room was dark fusty and miserable. If you have to have families rooms away from the bar for goodness sake make them welcoming and not depressing we felt as though we were second class citizens I have never felt more unwelcome than this.

reviews.title: Flat Beer & Grumpy Staff
reviews.text: For a Hotel/Pub you expect good service and happy staff. The Goathland Hotel doesn't come close. My two Uncles Ordered Lager and they both tasted flat and should have been especially good for the price. My cousin and I also got told off by a woman sat next to the Christmas tree for "touching" it. We did not touch it my cousin, being two years old, simply pointed in excitement at the Christmas tree. The manager was rude to my sister when she politely asked if they had a certain flavour of J2o. They should improve their attitude to paying customers and I would not rate this pub.

reviews.title: not at all friendly
reviews.text: I am not the type of person to write reviews but a single drink at the goathland hotel has inspired me to write my first one!!

reviews.title: Living on it's TV reputation
reviews.text: We popped in for a drink over the New Year period with another family after a walk around the area

reviews.title: Hot Choclate with Dog
reviews.text: We were greeted by the long face of what I presume is the manager who proceeded to be rude and totally aloof he may as well have said sorry I can’t really be bothered!! As that was the body language he was giving off. The bar is off limits to families (presumably to allow the half dozen or so locals to drink in peace, however I doubt whether it is their spending which keeps the hotel open and once the Heartbeat connection wears out I fear they may realise this!)

reviews.title: We were 'barked at' by miserable waitress
reviews.text: Called in for a bite to eat between trains, on a family holiday (3 generations) we were asked to take a seat in the family room as under 18's were not allowed in the bar which is fair enough. 5 adults ordered sandwiches and drinks and my sister inlaw got out my 2 year old nephews marmalade sandwiches ( his favourite at the moment and he always eats them) in came one of the more mature waitresses who snapped at us 'you can't bring your own picnics in here', we explained politely they were for a 2 year old. She didn't say a word and stomped off, only to return with our drinks and plonked them down on the table without a word.
We live only 20 miles away, I hope this was a one off as its not a very good welcome to Yorkshire is it? Her attitude spoilt our afternoon. Miserable.
reviews.title: Extremely nice!

reviews.text: I really enjoyed my visit here and I am glad I tried it out! The food was lovely and there was a very nice atmosphere. My children also enjoyed it and said they would love to go back. So thank you for the lovely day.
reviews.title: Pleasant Bar

reviews.text: We came to Goathland for the day and decided to call in for lunch. The bar was lovely and warm with an open log fire. We were served immediately and ordered the Burger and Fries with Cheese. It was lovely with some salad and a slice of orange. Staff polite and efficient. With soft drinks it was £19.00 so good value. Toilets clean and tidy.
reviews.title: Miserable
What a let down!
reviews.text: Popped in for a drink in the week and couldn't have been made feel any less welcome from the women behind the bar. Telling people to come around and not stand in the aisle

reviews.title: Friendly staff with good food.
reviews.text: My husband and I stopped in for a drink and some lunch. The barmaid - a young dark haired girl was friendly and polite and even offered to take a picture of us at the bar, even though the place was packed with lunch patrons. We enjoyed our lunch and the service we were provided with. No complaints. Glad we stopped here.

We stopped off at Goathland from the NYMR. I was extremely disappointed in the hotel, I ordered ham and pea soup and the soup had been so liquidised it was difficult to see any resemblance to pea and ham. Accompanying the lunch was a stale piece of bread which was completely unedible.
reviews.title: Quality of Food
Landlord has a captive audience....shame
reviews.text: I could not recommend this hotel to anyone.

reviews.title: Good lunch
reviews.text: Stopped here for a drink on our way back from Whitby. An avid Heartbeat fan I was excited to see the Aidensfield Arms pub as in the series. The landlord was quite rude I thought and it was obvious as passing trade we were not of much interest. It's a shame because its lovely to walk into the bar which is the same as the programme and reminisce. Would have stayed longer but felt disappointed by his attitude.

reviews.title: A Pleasant Enough Visit
reviews.text: We did not stay in the hotel but stopped in for lunch and a drink. Service was quick and efficient even though they were very busy. We shared a Ploughmans lunch which was very good. Not much room in the bar as it is very small. Worth a visit if your in the area.
